messages.title: A contract between the Conservative Party and
messages.content: I'm proud of the positive campaign the Conservatives have fought for this general election. Unfortunately, some of our opponents have not been so positive, and have made several claims about us that aren't true. I want to put the record straight. We will PROTECT pensions and the Pension Credit. We will SUPPORT Sure Start, and boost it by paying for an extra 4,200 trained Sure Start health visitors. [...]

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Change to the political system including greater accountability, power to local communities, and reduced number of MPs.
Cut wasteful government spending, act on national debt, reduce emissions and foster a greener economy.
Focus on societal issues with policies to support family breakdown prevention, educational failure, and crime.

issues.economy: Cut wasteful government spending, act on national debt, reduce emissions and build a greener economy with thousands of new jobs in manufacturing.
issues.education: Raise standards in schools, giving teachers the power to restore discipline and aspiring parents, charities and voluntary groups the power to start new smaller schools.
issues.environment: Reduce emissions and build a greener economy, with thousands of new jobs in manufacturing.
issues.governance: Our political system needs to change. Politics must be made more accountable and we must take power away from Westminster, and put it in the hands of people—individuals, families and neighbourhoods.
issues.health: Increase spending on health every year, more cutting waste in the NHS, so that while costs to nurses and doctors on the frontline, and make sure you get access to the cancer drugs you need.

leaflet.personalStatement: We go into the general election on 6 May with trust in politics and politicians at an all-time low. And I understand why: the years of broken promises, the expenses scandal, the feeling that politicians have become too remote from the people they've all taken their toll. That's why I'm writing to you now. [...]

images.caption: Image of David Cameron with a statement.
